column5: For many of us Americans who fish Ontario Canada we had to sign a form saying blah, blah, yeah we know how to run a boat with a 9.9 big deal right? Our Outfitter advised by next year we will be required to take an official boat safety course and provide proof if asked by CPP or water equivalent. I own a boat an have taken the course. Just a heads up its coming for 2023.
And make sure you have your receipt for your Canadian bought crawlers !
I'm guessing my USCG issued Capt's Lic will suffice....There's no more stringent testing than that one.
I have not heard this nor have I seen it come across the desk of NOTO. I will investigate. -FT
I agree with Jul's our USCG certification should be able to exempt us from that requirement.

i would bring it and not take the course. if the lodge owner wont let you use a boat, or a canadian RC wants to ticket you for not taking it, you found some of the biggest morons in the world.. now with saying that.. this day and age everything is a liablility issue. so if a lodge is specifically told, and they know the law is around checking. then their hands might be tied.
Are there a lot of boating accidents in Canada or what?? Rarely hear of a boating accident here in the states.
Are you serious? There are all kinds of boating accidents in the states. There were a couple of fatal ones down south this spring.

Really? Boating Accident Statistics Highlights of accident statistics: Boating fatalities surged 25.1% during the Covid pandemic. Over 5,000 boating accidents occur yearly in the U.S., causing $62.5 million in damages. Lack of boating safety education accounts for 77% of fatal accidents. Alcohol is the leading contributing factor in fatal boating accidents. 86% of drowning victims were not wearing a life jacket. Only 11.6% of adults and 65.8% of kids wear a life jacket. Collision with another vessel is the most common type of boating accident in the U.S. The majority of boating accidents take place in calm waters. Boat propeller accidents surged 44% during the Covid pandemic.https://uscgboating.org/library/acci...stics-2020.pdf
